results.title: A Place in the sun
results.brief_description: Director George Steven’s fought hard to make this powerful adaptation of Theodore Dreiser’s award-winning novel, “An American Tragedy”. Controversial and damning of the capitalist ethics of greed, this is a Hollywood melodrama of considerable insight and integrity. Montgomery Clift plays a young man from a poor religious family who begins working in his Uncle’s factory. He is attracted to the humble Alice (Shelley Winters) who works on the factory floor, but it is the rich Miss Vickers (Elizabeth Taylor) who he desperately wishes to love. She is a symbol of the status and wealth which he believes, as an American, is his due. When Alice falls pregnant and he realises all his hopes for success may be destroyed, he begins to slowly, painfully descend to thoughts of murder. With stunning performances by all three stars, a literate script and sumptuous direction by George Stevens, this is a labour of love deserving of its success. Winner of six Academy Awards.

results.title: The Greatest story ever told
results.creator_credit: George Stevens and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: With one of the finest film casts ever assembled, this epic has been hailed as the definitive screen version of the life and times of Jesus Christ. As Jesus, the internationally acclaimed Max Von Sydow reveals the compassion, anguish and glory of the “King of the Jews” in the performance of a lifetime. The distinguished ensemble cast also features Charlton Heston as John the Baptist, Jose Ferrer as King Herrod, John Wayne as the Centurion, Sidney Poitier as Simon of Cyrene, Telly Savalas as Pontius Pilate and Angela Lansbury as Claudia. Combining stellar performances, lavish sets, stunning locations and costing in excess of $20 million dollars, the story is true to the pages of the Gospel, earning five Academy Award nominations to become an enduring and revered classic.

results.title: 42nd Street
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Bacon, Hal B. Wallis, Vitaphone and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Here’s your ticket to “Shuffle off to Buffalo” with Ruby Keeler and Dick Powell in this beguiling Busby Berkeley showcase; a bold, enticing feast of choreography and imagination. Warner Baxter stars as Julian Marsh, a tyrannical director of Broadway musicals. When his show’s leading lady, played by Bebe Daniels, breaks her ankle on the eve of opening night, a wide-eyed chorus girl played by Ruby Keeler is thrust into the role. Also stars George Brent, Una Merkel and Dick Powell.

results.title: The Prince of tides
results.creator_credit: Barbra Streisand, Andrew S Karsch, Barwood Films, Columbia and Longfellow
results.brief_description: New York psychiatrist, Susan Lowenstein (Barbra Streisand) confronts her own private pain when she delves into Tom Wingo’s (Nick Nolte) memories of his family’s past. Together they search for the key that may save Tom’s twin sister who repeatedly attempts suicide. Nick Nolte gives the most heartfelt and powerful performance of his career as a man who, in order to mend his sister’s emotional wounds, must finally come to terms with his own. Based on the best-selling novel by Pat Conroy and nominated for seven Academy Awards, this film is a compelling exploration of love - between men and women, parents and children, and, ultimately, love of oneself.

results.title: Misery
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman, Castle Rock and Nelson Entertainment
results.brief_description:
He was a writer. She was his “Number One Fan”. She pulled him out of a car wreck, brought him home, splint and set his mangled legs. All Paul Sheldon had to do in return was write a very special book, just for her, all about her favourite character from his novels. One he had killed off and has to bring back to life. Now he not only has to write to save his character’s life, but he also has to write to save his own. James Caan is brilliant as the Gothic novellist who wants to change his genre and Kathy Bates, in her 1990 Best Actress Academy Award winning-role, is perfect as the obsessed fan who only wants to save her favourite character, even if it means killing the person who created it!
Cast also includes: Lauren Bacall, Richard Farnsworth

results.title: Village of the damned
results.creator_credit: Wolf Rilla, Ronald Kinnoch and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: From its seemingly placid opening, this tale of an ordinary British village facing an extraordinary foe keeps piling one eerie and disquieting detail upon another, creating an utterly believable masterpiece of horror. The trouble begins when, one normal day a strange supernatural force makes everybody in the village unconscious. When the villagers come to they they find that every capable woman in the village is pregnant. However, all the children are born on the same day and they all look alike - platinum-blonde hair, piercing eyes and the ability to read the unformed thoughts of human beings. Their rapid physical development is matched by their fast-growing mental powers and with calm, blood-curdling efficiency, they are soon terrorising the tiny hamlet - climaxing in an ending which has long-lasting ramifications on the use and misuse of scientific knowledge. Based on the novel “The Midwich cuckoos” by John Wyndham.

results.title: Rumble Fish
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Doug Claybourne, Fred Roos and Zoetrope Studios
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning director Francis Ford Coppola’s visually stunning adaptation of the S.E. Hinton novel. Starring teen heart-throbs Matt Dillon and Mickey Rourke as two brothers whose desire to break out of their urban trap eventually leads to death for one and a new beginning for the other. Photographed in black and white with colour sequences, this striking production features a brilliant supporting cast including Dennis Hopper and boasts a musical score by Stewart Copeland.

results.title: The Way we were
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Ray Stark, Columbia and Rastar Productions
results.brief_description: Barbra Streisand and Robert Redford star in one of Hollywood’s legendary love stories. Redford is the boy who sets out to become the top film writer in Hollywood and Streisand is the outspoken activist. Their love binds them together, but their beliefs put them on a collision course which ultimately tears them apart. Redford is charming as the all-American WASP boy, while Streisands performance as the “blue-stocking” Jewish activist is moving, as she vacillates between fragility and passionate committment to her causes. Although uneven and at times unashamedly sentimental, the film is a classic of its genre. Marvin Hamlisch’s score and the title song earned Oscars for the film.

results.title: The Ghost and Mrs. Muir
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Fred Kohlmar and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Lucy Muir (Gene Tierney) a beautiful widow and her daughter (Natalie Wood) rent a house by the ocean, and refuse to be frightened by the former owner’s ghost, a dashing sea captain (Rex Harrison). When her income suddenly stops, he suggests that they collaborate on a book about his life and the unlikely pair fall deeply in love. Then Lucy’s affection is challenged by a live man (George Sanders), leaving the broken-hearted captain to choose another course. Acclaimed for its heartwarming screenplay and Oscar-nominated cinematography, this film is a moving, sentimental Hollywood classic.

results.title: Lawrence of Arabia [Director's cut]
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Sam Spiegel, Columbia and Horizon (GB)
results.brief_description: A sweeping, breathtaking epic covering the life of T. E. Lawrence. Throughout his two years in Arabia during the First World War, he succeeded in uniting the Arab tribes against the Turks and became a legend in his own time, the great Lawrence of Arabia. Starring Peter O’Toole, Omar Sharif, Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn, Jack Hawkins, Claude Rains, Jose Ferrer and Anthony Quayle, Lean’s breathtaking film won seven Oscars in 1962, despite suffering some major cuts, with loss of footage for thirty years. Those dramatic scenes have been restored in this Director’s Cut.
